title: Google Android Bluetooth hci_len Heap-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows attackers in close proximity to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Google Android. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must accept a malicious file transfer.
The specific flaw exists within the parsing of Bluetooth packet lengths. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length heap-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process.
addtionnal_details:
This vulnerability is being disclosed publicly without a patch in accordance with the ZDI 120 day deadline.
